title: ICE: `rustc` crashes in a `chroot` sandbox

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This error happens when running `cargo` from `bazel`, which is in turn running in a `chroot` sandbox on Centos 7. Running with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` unfortunately makes the error disappear, so we don't know why `rustc` needs to read `/proc/self/exe` and why only when compiling DD.

This is rustc 1.35

Note: the sandbox _does_  have `/proc` mounted in it, so this is not a duplicate of #56249
